intro: Funastrum fragile, commonly known as the brittle funastrum, is a rare and delicate plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and unique, inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its stems are fragile and easily broken, contributing to its common name. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often difficult to study in the wild.
